meanings.definition: To improve or become better in terms of physical fitness or appearance.
meanings.sent1: I need to shapeup before the big race next month.
meanings.sent2: She decided to shapeup by going to the gym regularly.
meanings.sent3: Trying to shapeup by eating only junk food is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to shapeup was like a bright light guiding her path.
meanings.sent5: He knew he had to shapeup if he wanted to keep up with his active friends.

meanings.definition: A process of organizing or improving something.
meanings.sent1: The shapeup of the company's finances was long overdue.
meanings.sent2: The team had a shapeup meeting to discuss the new project.
meanings.sent3: The shapeup of the messy closet took longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The shapeup of the garden transformed it into a beautiful oasis.
meanings.sent5: The shapeup of the schedule made everything run more smoothly.

meanings.sent1: His shapeup was impressive after months of training.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her shapeup after following a healthy diet.
meanings.sent3: The cat's shapeup after grooming made it look like a different animal.
meanings.sent4: The old car's shapeup with a fresh coat of paint made it look brand new.
meanings.sent5: The room's shapeup with new furniture gave it a modern feel.
